snippet: More than one million people lost electricity for more than 24 hours after a power cooperative was cut off for $92 million in unpaid bills.
abstract: National Grid Corporation of the Philippines cuts electricity in Albay Province for more than a day over $92 million in unpaid bills; power is restored after energy secretary calls an emergency meeting of national and provincial power officials, and the local power cooperative agrees to pay the overdue amount for June of about $440,000 within five days.
lead_paragraph: More than one million people lost electricity for more than 24 hours after a power cooperative was cut off for $92 million in unpaid bills.

headline.main: Bills Unpaid, Power Is Cut to Province in Philippines
headline.print_headline: Bills Unpaid, Power Is Cut To Province In Philippines
